alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 2:43PM CDT until June 10 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Forrest County in southeastern Mississippi... Northeastern Lamar County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 243 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. A few roads have been closed due to flooding in Hattiesburg. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hattiesburg, Petal, West Hattiesburg, Oak Grove and Sunrise. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
